cs3524.mud

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs3524.mud.Location
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Location
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a location on a map. A location can be considered as a vertex of a graph.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Location(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a location with just a name.
      Location(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description)
      Creates a location with a name and a description.
      Location(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, java.util.ArrayList<Item> items)
      Creates a location with a name, a description and a number of specified items.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPlayer(java.lang.String p)
      Places a player at this location.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Compares two instances of the Location class.
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns the description of the location.
      java.util.Map<Direction,Location> getDestinations()
      Returns the map of destinations accessible from this location.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the location.
      java.util.List<Item> listItems()
      Returns the list of items stored at this location.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> listPlayerNames()
      Lists the names of all players currently at this location.
      void removePlayer(java.lang.String p)
      Removes a player from this location.
      void store(Item item)
      Stores an item at the location.
      Location to_the(Direction d)
      Returns the location which is accessible from this location, when going in the specified direction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Location

        public Location(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a location with just a name. The rest defaults to empty strings, lists and maps.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the location

      • Location

        public Location(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String description)
        Creates a location with a name and a description. The rest defaults to empty lists and maps.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the location
        description - the description of a location

      • Location

        public Location(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String description,
                java.util.ArrayList<Item> items)
        Creates a location with a name, a description and a number of specified items. The rest defaults to an empty list and and an empty map.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the location
        description - the description of a location
        items - the list of items, which will be stored at this location upon creation

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares two instances of the Location class. For this project, it was assumed, that any two locations, which have the same name are considered equal. This is mainly to simplify searching through the list of locations in a World using the standard methods like .contains().
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - an object to compare to

        Stores an item at the location.
